page.title: 18Recreation
page.content: Recreation has to be self-made or sought outside the area. There are no playing fields or organised games, though some women take part in recreational activities arranged by the Women's Institutes, mainly swimming, bowling, bridge. rounders. Gardening is probably the single most popular recreation.There are many beautiful gardens, both large and small, tended with much quiet enjoyment by their owners. Two fox hunts,North Ledbury and Clifton on Teme, cross the area, though not all landowners welcome them. Others ride simply for pleasure. There is some rough shooting over the farmland. There is a mobile library which calls once a month.
